title: Senior Qualitative Researcher
description: Senior Qualitative ResearcherW2 hourly contract Remote, must be in PST, MST, or CST20+ week contractPay: $75 - 92/hr. You will partner with key stakeholders across product management, design, marketing, analytics and data science, and engineering to influence product design and direction. You will conduct end- to-end research using a variety of methodologies, to help us gain confidence in our understanding of our users (current and future), their needs and the opportunity this uncovers for our products. You'll be empowered to work with autonomy and creativity every step of the way, collaborating with stakeholders to determine where the greatest impact can be made, and to triage research requests. We expect you to draw on other research programs and specialties within the wider team to bring additional depth and reliability to your insights, and effectively represent user research in key product discussions. You will have the opportunity to develop a deep understanding of how teams work together in all kinds of industries, all around the world and contribute to the development of a strong and innovative researchpractice. Perform qualitative research that may be generative orevaluative. Drive the research cycle, work with stakeholders, establish appropriateresearch methods and share insights. On day one, we expect you to have: 5 years of hands-on experience designing and conducting Qualitative user research that has had an impact.We expect to hear stories of how your research influenced product roadmaps and informed design decisions.Experience in B2B Tech or SaaS companiesExperience with a variety of qualitative research techniques (remote and in-person), along with the knowledge of when, why and how to apply them. We value your ability to be creative when thinking about the research problem you're trying to solve, and your ability to bring your team along on the journey of your discoveries.Communication skills that influence and inspire change. You know how to analyze qualitative data, synthesize into a coherent and truthful story, and how to create effective ways of sharing your insights so they resonate and are impactful across diverse audiences. Preferred if you also have: MA or PhD in behavioral or social sciences, such as psychology, anthropology, sociology, human factors or a related subject area.A demonstrated ability to design, execute, and explain high quality mixed-methods (qual and quant) research, and to synthesize results across multiple methods.Professional experience in applied product research, preferably for a commercial B2B, B2C, or SaaS product, with a track record of your research being presented to influence product design and direction.An ability to implement creative approaches to researching often complex user experience challenges, and to communicate complex ideas into concise summaries with impactful storytelling. More about our team You'll be joining a smart and passionate team of mixed methods researchers, spread across the globe. We work together to continuously improve our craft as researchers and our ability to support us to build better experiences for our customers and users. We have a mix of foundational, product and survey research programs that allows us to both follow the users' journey wherever it may take us, as well as having deep impact at the product level. It's all about improving our users' experience no matter who or where it is.

title: Data Analyst, Experimentation

description: As the Senior Data Analyst, Experimentation you will join a cross-functional team focused on developing and promoting experimentation standards across the enterprise. In tandem with the experimentation product and engineering leads, you will work to improve the depth of insights while always looking to shorten the speed of learning. This is a senior-level individual contributor role in which you will help to standardize testing set-up, definition and reporting of metrics, unlocking new data pipelines and making insight actionable through concise readouts to the broader organization.You will be a critical in helping to develop our testing capabilities and in quantifying the combined testing impact across the enterprise. The role requires both a strong strategic and tactical perspective, you will lean heavily on your collaboration skills to get work done, and will drive innovation through endless curiosity. We expect you to uncover actionable insights in customer behavior, support decision making and strategy, and create strong feedback loops through data analysis and visualization.You will help ELC to deeply understand our users, their problems, where they find value, and consistently strive to improve the overall customer experience from start to finish. You thrive within ambiguity and find new, creative ways to solve problems every day, with data as your guide.Key Responsibilities Analyze experiment results and present findings in an actionable and concise manner; effectively communicating the story behind the test results to varied audiences, including executive leadership.In partnership with the Experimentation Product Manager, recommend experiment methodology, as well as primary and secondary success measures to ensure all experiments are designed to deliver the desired insights.Inform experiment prioritization by auditing proposed ideas, analyzing the potential business benefit, ROI, and likelihood to deliver actionable insights.Monitor and measure launched experiments, synthesizing results from testing to continually inform the product development lifecycle.Participate in and influence the scaling of the experimentation program. Serve as the ‘voice of data’ as we refine the program workflow, governance structure, and training and on-boarding for new brands and markets.Lead efforts to improve the depth of insights derived from experiments. Partner with broader analytics and data science practitioners within ELC to gain access to more robust data sets.Deeply curious: you operate with a sense of urgency and always look for new ways to understand our customers and create value on their behalfData-fluent: you use data to solve problems, identify opportunities, and are capable of inventing and using new metrics to learn and make decisionsBiased for action: you make good decisions with incomplete data and are constantly optimizing for learning.An owner: you can seamlessly straddle thinking about both the product and the business and are equally comfortable talking about funnel metrics and P+L's. You are willing to get your hands dirty and do whatever it takes to ensure success.What We Are Looking ForBachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Data Science or related field7+ years of experience in data analysis and reporting, data science, business intelligence, or business and financial analysisAdvanced knowledge of analytical and statistical methods and the technical competence to apply these methodsStrong experience with A/B testing, experimentation, and causal inference models. Well versed in test design including power analysis.High proficiency of SQL and experience with data platforms (Google BigQuery, Looker)Experience with experimentation tools (Optimizely, Google Optimize, Adobe Target, etc)Experience with behavioral analytics tools (Google Analytics, Adobe analytics, FullStory, Quantum Metric etc)Ability to craft an engaging narrative backed with concise data visualizations to broad audiencesWorks effectively in a remote environment with cross functional teams. Able to build trusted partnershipSelf-starter and self-motivated with the proven ability to deliver results in a fast-paced, high-energy environmentExcellent written and verbal communication skillsExperience utilizing data to drive decisions and change minds.Experience working in agile methodologiesExperience working in a product-led organizationAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: ServiceNow Developer/Administrator

The role focuses heavily on establishing Best Practices and maintaining Knowledge content for the supported solutions and modules. The ServiceNow Developer portion of the role (50%) is responsible for enhancements across all aspects of the ServiceNow environment. This position works primarily with a Scrum team, on User Stories created through a Demand intake process and works closely with business analyst to deliver enhancements across multiple modules on the platform. This role also works closely with the Platform architect to identify solutions through existing functionality or customizations, as well as developing, testing, installing, and maintaining new or modified solutions on the platform. title: Senior Qualitative Researcher
description: Senior Qualitative ResearcherW2 hourly contract Remote, must be in PST, MST, or CST20+ week contractPay: $75 - 92/hr. You will partner with key stakeholders across product management, design, marketing, analytics and data science, and engineering to influence product design and direction. You will conduct end- to-end research using a variety of methodologies, to help us gain confidence in our understanding of our users (current and future), their needs and the opportunity this uncovers for our products. You'll be empowered to work with autonomy and creativity every step of the way, collaborating with stakeholders to determine where the greatest impact can be made, and to triage research requests. We expect you to draw on other research programs and specialties within the wider team to bring additional depth and reliability to your insights, and effectively represent user research in key product discussions. You will have the opportunity to develop a deep understanding of how teams work together in all kinds of industries, all around the world and contribute to the development of a strong and innovative researchpractice. Perform qualitative research that may be generative orevaluative. Drive the research cycle, work with stakeholders, establish appropriateresearch methods and share insights. On day one, we expect you to have: 5 years of hands-on experience designing and conducting Qualitative user research that has had an impact.We expect to hear stories of how your research influenced product roadmaps and informed design decisions.Experience in B2B Tech or SaaS companiesExperience with a variety of qualitative research techniques (remote and in-person), along with the knowledge of when, why and how to apply them. We value your ability to be creative when thinking about the research problem you're trying to solve, and your ability to bring your team along on the journey of your discoveries.Communication skills that influence and inspire change. You know how to analyze qualitative data, synthesize into a coherent and truthful story, and how to create effective ways of sharing your insights so they resonate and are impactful across diverse audiences. Preferred if you also have: MA or PhD in behavioral or social sciences, such as psychology, anthropology, sociology, human factors or a related subject area.A demonstrated ability to design, execute, and explain high quality mixed-methods (qual and quant) research, and to synthesize results across multiple methods.Professional experience in applied product research, preferably for a commercial B2B, B2C, or SaaS product, with a track record of your research being presented to influence product design and direction.An ability to implement creative approaches to researching often complex user experience challenges, and to communicate complex ideas into concise summaries with impactful storytelling. More about our team You'll be joining a smart and passionate team of mixed methods researchers, spread across the globe. We work together to continuously improve our craft as researchers and our ability to support us to build better experiences for our customers and users. We have a mix of foundational, product and survey research programs that allows us to both follow the users' journey wherever it may take us, as well as having deep impact at the product level. It's all about improving our users' experience no matter who or where it is.
